question: A bus company provides an online service for passengers to find bus routes. What information should passengers input? (1) Starting point (2) Destination (3) Number of bus stops (4) Bus fare
What are the 8-bit one's complement and 8-bit two's complement of the binary number 10110 ?
Which of the following actions involve converting data between digital and analog forms? (1) Playing mp3 music (2) Recording videos using a webcam (3) Copying a text file
Peter configures the colour quality of a display unit. Which of the following pixels are involved? (1) Black (2) White (3) Green (4) Red (5) Blue

Peter and Mary share a database file X and execute database queries, T1 and T2, respectively. Which of the following activities should the database management system not do? (1) When T1 is reading X, T2 is reading X. (2) When T1 is writing records in X, T2 is writing records in X. (3) When T1 is deleting records in X, T2 is reading X.
Which of the following statements about clicking a hyperlink in a presentation file is correct?
option_a: The hyperlink needs to involve HTTP.
option_b: A browser will not open when the hyperlink is "http://hkeaa.edu.hk/hke.doc".
option_c: A PDF reader will usually open when the hyperlink links to a PDF file.
option_d: The presentation file will close automatically when the hyperlink links to another presentation file.

question: Assume that every household has a residential telephone number. In which of the following database applications could the residential telephone number be used as a key field?

Why should a software suite be used in an IT project? (1) Data used in the project can be shared within the software suite effectively. (2) Data files generated by the software suite are smaller. (3) The project will be in a web-based format.
Which of the following statements about a check digit for a data item is correct?
option_a: The check digit cannot find all errors.
option_b: The data item should not contain more than 8 characters.
option_c: The check digit can correct errors.
option_d: The leading character of the data item should be a letter.

question: When editing a document, which of the following word processing features can enhance its readability? (1) Tables (2) Find and replace (3) Footnotes
Which of the following is the main development trend for display units in desktop computers?

Tom currently uses a software package on a desktop computer. He tries to install this software on his tablet computer but fails. Why? (1) The tablet computer uses a different operating system. (2) The tablet computer uses a virtual keyboard. (3) The tablet computer uses a solid-state drive.

Why do many readers like using mobile devices to read books? (1) The ergonomic design of mobile devices helps relieve eye strain. (2) Mobile devices provide various functions which make reading convenient. (3) It is convenient for carrying a lot of books.
Carey wants to upgrade the DDR II 2G 667 MHz RAM of her computer to DDR III 2G 1333MHz RAM with a higher data transfer rate. Which of the following features should be considered?
What is the main purpose of having a memory cache in a CPU?
option_a: It increases the total memory storage capacity.
option_b: It facilitates the CPU processors on the motherboard.
option_c: It supports multi-core processors operating systems.

question: When buying a wireless broadband router for a network at home, which of the following considerations is not necessary?
option_a: The data transfer rate of the broadband connection
option_c: The IP address of the router

question: Carol uses a digital camera to take photos of her school hall. The photos will be uploaded and shown on the school's web pages. Which of the following image file types are suitable for her to use? (1) PNG (2) GIF (3) JPG (4) TIFF
Carol uses a digital camera to take photos of her school hall. The photos will be uploaded and shown on the school's web pages. Before uploading a photo, what should Carol do?
option_a: If the file size of the photo is very large, she should divide it into small files for uploading.
option_b: She should reduce the photo size to fit the display.
option_c: She should adjust the resolution of the photo so that it is as high as possible
option_d: She should adjust the number of colours shown in the photo to the highest number possible

question: Henry lives in Hong Kong. He likes bags made in Europe so he buys a bag through the online shopping web site of a shop in France. What are the possible reasons for Henry's choice to buy the bag online? (1) He can select and buy the bag during office hours in France. (2) There are many different kinds of bags for Henry to choose from. (3) The bag is not for sale in Hong Kong. (4) He has a credit card to pay for it.

Henry lives in Hong Kong. He likes bags made in Europe so he buys a bag through the online shopping web site of a shop in France. There are different kinds of online shopping web sites. What features do they usually have? (1) Electronic Fund Transfer (2) A peer-to-peer (p2p) network (3) Mainframe computers (4) A Database Management System (DBMS)
Which of the following can enhance the security of online banking? (1) Remote logon (2) Tokens (3) Peer-to-peer network

Why should network interface cards (NICs) be used in a computer network? (1) The network needs to support data transfer at 10GB per second. (2) NICs convert analog signals into digital signals and vice versa.
When using Internet search engines, it is better to include operators like '-' in search strings because
option_a: The search time can be shorter.
option_b: The search results include the titles of web pages only.
option_c: The search results can be more relevant.
option_d: The search results can include both local and foreign web sites.

question: At home, Mary can access the HKEEA's web site by entering http://www.hkeaa.edu.hk, but she can do it by entering http://210.0.205.228. Why?
option_a: The DNS server is out of service.
option_b: The web server is out of service.
option_c: Her web browser needs an extra plug-in.
option_d: The router used at home is out of order.

question: John can view an online video on the computer at home but not on the computer in his school. Why?
option_a: The operating system does not support the video playback.
option_b: The browsers does not support the video playback.
option_c: The video is not in HTML format.
option_d: The maximum data transfer rate of the school network is low.

question: In an IT project, Tom has written the source code. He tests it with valid input data items. What should he do next?
option_a: Check the modularity of the program design.
option_d: Continue to test the program with invalid data items.

question: Which of the following statements about open source software is correct?
option_a: It is free of program bugs.
option_c: It can be modified and distributed freely.
option_d: It runs faster in a networked operating system.

question: At home, John unintentionally detects his neighbour's WiFi network without any security measures. He can fully control the wireless router. What should he do?
option_b: Connect to the network for web browsing only.
option_c: Connect to the network for transferring large files only.
option_d: Configure the wireless router with an authentication key.

question: Some teenagers in Hong Kong are addicted to playing online games. Which of the following behaviours are common in this group of teenagers? (1) They prefer playing online games to joining face-to-face social activities. (2) They play online games as a way of escaping from daily life problems. (3) They feel irritable when being stopped from using computers.

When a virus is spread through a Bluetooth connection, which of the following applications installed on a notebook computer can prevent the infection? (1) Firewall (2) Email client program (3) Browser

The Hong Kong Government launched the Internet Support Learning Programme in 2011. The Programme helps needy students to acquire computer equipment and Internet access services. What issue is the Government addressing?

In a museum, visitors can stand in front of a kiosk with a monitor and a keyboard to access visitor information. Which of the following relate to ergonomic matters? (1) The viewing angle of the monitor is adjustable. (2) The height of the keyboard tray is adjustable. (3) Provide a mouse.
In a DBMS, a database designer designs a form for a clerk to use to enter data. Why does he choose to design a form?
option_c: More data can be entered at the same time.
option_d: The data entry uses less system computation time.

question: A public library is going to digitise a collection of valuable antique books. What is the major benefit of digitisation?
option_a: The library can destroy the books to save storage space.
option_b: More people can easily access the books.
option_d: It improves the protection of intellectual property.

question: In data processing, a clerk in a school types in the examination marks of students from a mark sheet into a computer system. Then he prints out the marks. What should he do next?
option_c: Find the student with the highest mark.
option_d: Check the printout against the mark sheet.

question: Mary uses a utility program to group the following 100 document files and combine them into a file named ALL.ZIP, and sends an email with this file. Why does she do this?
option_a: It is easier to send and receive the documents.
option_b: The file size of the email is smaller.

question: Arthur inserts a video clip in a presentation file and sends an email with the file to Betty. When Betty opens the file, there is only text and the video is missing. Why?
option_a: The video is infected with a computer virus and has been removed by an antivirus program.
option_c: Linking instead of embedding is used when inserting the video in the presentation file.
option_d: The video is in MP4 format instead of AVI format.

question: A combination lock consists of 5 separate switches. Each switch can be set to either the 'ON' or 'OFF' state. The lock can only be unlocked when all 5 switches are set to the correct switch states. How many different combinations of switch states does this lock have?
Which operations are performed by the following SQL command? SELECT * FROM EXAM WHERE CLASS='1A' ORDER BY SCORE DESC. (1) Sorting (2) Counting (3) Filtering (4) Updating
In a data transmission system, a parity check is applied. One of the following received codes is invalid. Which one is it?

With 8-bit two's complement representation, which of the following operations can produce an overflow error? (1) Addition of two positive integers and Addition of two negative integers (2) Addition of two negative integers (3) Addition of a positive integer and negative integer
When editing page numbers and hyperlinks in a document, which of the following statements is correct?
option_a: A browser must be open when clicking the hyperlinks.
option_b: The page numbers are printed as footnotes.
option_c: The hyperlinks facilitate the reading of the document.
option_d: The page numbers must start from 1.

question: Which of the following features in presentation software can control the transition of slides? (1) Action button (2) Hyperlink (3) Slide layout

Ms Wong works in a publishing company and has to create the following three documents. (1) payment receipt (2) electronic book (3) template of a sales report. For which document(s) should she adopt the PDF format instead of the DOC format?
Cathy uses 'what-if' analysis in a spreadsheet to solve a problem. Which of the following statements about the analysis is correct?
option_a: The 'what-if' analysis involves different data sets.
option_b: The 'what-if' analysis involves different descriptions of the problem.
option_c: The problem involves a database file.
option_d: The problem involves a document file.

question: Which of the following operations will enlarge the icons and text displayed on a visual display unit?
option_a: Reduce the number of colours displayed.
option_b: Increase the number of colours displayed.

question: Peter upgrades his desktop computer with a touch screen. Why?
option_a: This is a good ergonomic practice.
option_b: Many operating systems support touch screens.
option_c: A touch screen can be installed easily.
option_d: A touch screen allows for easier hand eye coordination than a keyboard.

question: A supermarket uses thermal printers instead of dot-matrix printers to print receipts. What are the major reasons for using thermal printers? (1) Less printing noise (2) Shorter printing time (3) More durable receipts
The 64-bit version of an operating system is better than the 32-bit version because
option_a: the processing power of the CPU is higher.
option_b: the operating system can address more memory locations.
option_d: the data transfer rate of RAM is higher.

question: In an instruction fetch cycle, which of the following registers are involved? (1) Accumulator (2) Memory Data Register (MDR) (3) Memory Address Register (MAR)

A charity organisation wants to donate laptop computers to the children in developing countries for elearning. With a limited budget, only one item in the original specifications can be upgraded. Which of these is the most appropriate?
option_a: No network card to 802.11n network interface card
option_b: Built-in graphics card to graphics card with 2G RAM
option_d: DVD disc drive to Blu-ray disc drive

question: A search engine can automatically return the search results related to the country in which the computer is located. Which of the following discloses this location information?
A company develops an internal email system. It adopts HTML format instead of plain text for the email because
option_d: the POP protocol can be used.

question: In an email system, what is the use of IMAP and SMTP?
option_a: IMAP and SMTP are application programs that regulate email transmission.
option_b: IMAP and SMTP are the part of the operating system that manages email resources.
option_c: IMAP and SMTP are utility programs that improve the efficiency of email transmission.
option_d: IMAP and SMTP are sets of rules that determine how email is transmitted.

question: Which of the following is a function of a switch? (1) Connects computers to form a LAN. (2) Controls the network traffic in a network. (3) Joins two networks. (4) Connects a LAN to the Internet
What is the major advantage of using an array in algorithm design?
option_a: The modular approach can be used in the design.
option_b: It is useful in iteration design.
option_c: The size of an array is flexible.

question: Which of the following statements about open source software is correct?
option_a: Open source software is written by open source programming languages.
option_b: Open source software is executed in open source operating systems.
option_c: The source code can be copied, modified and redistributed freely.
option_d: Private companies cannot use open source software to make a profit.

question: Which of the following can reduce the threats from using social networking web sites? (1) Block or ignore people that you do not know or trust. (2) Use default privacy settings to restrict access. (3) Only disclose the name and address in the account.
In a company, all URLs browsed through the office computers are recorded by a proxy server. Which of the following statements is correct?
option_a: The URLs should be recorded during office hours only.
option_b: The records should be checked by authorised staff only.
option_c: The records are the digital property of the staff.
option_d: The company has committed a computer crime.

question: For the sake of their health, users should take a rest after every hour of computer use. A software company wants to improve its word processing software to include this ergonomic feature. When a user uses the software for an hour, the software should (1) display an alert message on the screen. (2) send an alert email to the user. (3) shut down the computer automatically.

Peter uses peer-to-peer file sharing software to download a commercial application program. His friends advise him not to install it. Why? (1) His action will create a digital divide. (2) The application program may be spyware. (3) He may infringe copyright law.

Which of the following activities involve(s) the conversion of analog to digital data or vice versa? (1) Talking to a friend on a mobile phone (2) Listening to a radio programme over the Internet (3) Copying a file from a DVD-R to a hard disk

A computer system uses the Hong Kong identity card (HKID) number as a key field for managing accounts. Its check digit is used to detect input errors made by users. Which of the following input errors can usually be found by the check digit? (1) Use another person's HKID number. (2) Swap two digits in the HKID number. (3) Input a wrong digit in the HKID number.
Increment the following numbers using 8-bit two's complement representation by 1. Which one will create an overflow error?
In a computer system, 10 bits are reserved for user identity codes and 54 bits are reserved for alias names. What is the maximum number of user accounts in the system?
Mr Lee wants to set up a cleaning service company to serve thousands of clients. He needs to process data about the service and create a monthly report for each client. Which software should he buy?

Only one record is retrieved after executing the following SQL command. Why? SELECT NAME, PHONE FROM EMPLOYEE (1) There is only one record in EMPLOYEE. (2) The content of NAME or PHONE in the remaining records is empty. (3) There may be some other fields in EMPLOYEE.

John uses his notebook computer to create a web-based presentation through a web site. He does not use the pre-installed presentation software to do so. Why? (1) He can add more slides in the presentation. (2) He can edit the presentation in other computers without presentation software. (3) He can add video clips in the presentation.
When creating a database table, what should be defined? (1) Data type (2) Field name (3) Number of records

Which of the following is/are the best practice when using online banking systems? (1) Create an uncommon login name. (2) Use a combination of letters and numbers for the passwords and change them regularly. (3) Avoid using wired network when wireless network is available.

In 2012, the US Government launched a project to explore how 'big data' could be used. 'Big data' refers to the huge amount of data collected which is difficult to process using database management systems. Which of the following are examples of 'big data'? (1) Human DNA (2) User behaviour in a social networking web site (3) The total number of government officials in the US
The following QR code is printed on an advertisement so that readers can scan the code and browse product information online through smart phones. What information is encoded in the QR code?
option_d: Name of the product in binary codes

question: A WAV file, which is a common audio file, consists of a header. Which of the following items is stored in the header?

Mary converts the file animal.bmp to animal.jpg. Why? (1) She wants to create a web page with this image. (2) She wants to store the image in DVD-R. (3) She wants to increase the resolution of the image.
A quad-core processor is generally better than a dual-core processor because
option_c: more instructions can be executed at the same time.
option_d: a graphics processing unit (GPU) can be installed.

question: Mary connects a new USB flash drive to a computer. She does not need to install a driver program for the flash drive. Why not?
option_a: A USB flash drive does not require a driver program.
option_b: The flash drive uses the same driver program as the hard disk.
option_c: The computer does not connect to the Internet.
option_d: The operating system in the computer has the driver program for the flash drive already.

question: A car is equipped with a global positioning system (GPS) such that the driver can get the location and time information when driving. Which of the following best describes the mode of operation of the system?
Which of the following classifications is correct? (Computer hardware; System software)
Joseph installs network-attached storage (NAS) in the office network that operates as a file server. If he installs more cache memory in the NAS, which of the following can be greatly improved?
When browsing a web page, which of the following will be involved? (1) IP (2) URL (3) FTP
In an email application, the settings of X and Y are used for receiving email and sending email respectively.

Mary has a wireless network with Internet access at home. She finds that the file transfer rate between a notebook computer and a desktop computer through the network is very low. What is the possible reason for this?
option_c: The communication protocols used by the two computers are different.
option_d: There is a thick wall between the computers and the wireless router.

question: A proxy server in a school network can ______. (1) increase the bandwidth of the Internet connection (2) filter web sites (3) store web pages for caching

What is/are the advantage(s) of using tablet computers in e-learning? (1) Students can easily carry tablet computers and access a Wi-Fi network. (2) Tablet computers can store a large amount of learning materials so that online resources will not be necessary. (3) Tablet computers have a high processing power.
Peter can use the following two methods to download files. He chooses Method 1. Why? Method 1: Direct download through HTTP Method 2: Download using Peer-to-Peer (P2P) file sharing technology
option_c: The data transfer rate is higher.
option_d: It is illegal to use Method 2.

question: When constructing tables in a web page, which of the following attributes of the tables can be set? (1) Page margin (2) Border (3) Text alignment

The sales department of an insurance company wants to improve service to its clients. It asks the IT project manager to establish some web pages for the clients. What should the IT project manager do first?
option_a: Define the scope of the service.
option_d: Set up a project team and recruit programmers.

question: Which of the following public policies can improve the digital divide in Hong Kong? (1) Subsidise low-income families so that they can get Internet access at home. (2) Provide computer equipment to students in need. (3) Give free training courses to citizens who lack basic IT skills.

Mary is a teenager and makes a new friend, Ada, through a random search function in a social networking web site. Ada wants to meet Mary the following Monday night at 10 p.m. in a restaurant. Mary's eldest brother advises her not to meet Ada. What is the major reason?
option_a: Mary can use another function in the social networking web site to make new friends.
option_b: Mary's eldest brother cannot join the meeting.
option_d: Mary can meet another friend earlier.

question: John does not download patches to upgrade the operating system of his computer. Which of the following statements best describes the possible consequences?
option_a: The license of the operating system will soon expire and he will have to re-install it.
option_b: The operating system may be more vulnerable to attacks by hackers.
option_c: The computer cannot connect to the Internet.
option_d: The IP address of the computer may need to be changed.

question: Which of the following can help visually impaired persons to browse the web? (1) Braille display device (2) Web filtering software (3) Screen magnification software
Which of the following statements about copyright protection in Hong Kong is correct?
option_a: Ideas are not protected unless they are in the form of expressions or products.
option_b: The Customs and Excise Department cannot take legal action against copyright piracy unless the copyright owners file a complaint.
option_c: A book cannot be protected unless it is published in Hong Kong.
option_d: Computer programs are not protected unless the copyright owners inform the Office of the Government Chief Information Officer (OGCIO).

question: Which of the following actions for desktop computers is/are environmentally-friendly? (1) Enable the power management function. (2) Lower the screen resolution. (3) Use LED monitors instead of CRT monitors.
In an office network, a technician installs a firewall instead of antivirus software. What is the major reason for this?
option_a: The computers in the office can be protected from adware.
option_b: The network can be protected from online security threats.
option_c: File transfer through the network can be faster.
option_d: The network can withstand virus attacks.

question: An 8-bit code 10010011 is received without an error. The last bit is a parity bit. Using the same parity check, which of the following received codes has an error?
Arrange the following 4-bit numbers using two's complement representation in ascending order. (1) 1000 (2) 0100 (3) 0111 (4) 1111
When using a database management systems tool, what is the major purpose of a query?
option_a: Adjust the layout of a database report.

question: A company uses a smart card system to record the attendance records of its employees. When an employee enters the company's office, he puts his smart card on a card reader and a new record is generated and stored in a database table. Which of the following fields are essential in the new record? (1) Smart card number (2) Employee's name (3) Employee's department (4) Time of entering the office

10,000 runners participate in a marathon competition. Each runner has a unique identity code stored in a RFID (radio-frequency identification) tag on one of his or her shoes. What is the minimum storage size required in each tag?

In a law firm, the lawyers need to read many archive documents every day. The firm plans to scan and store its archive documents as digital images so that the lawyers can use computers to search and view the documents. What is the major benefit of such digitisation?
option_a: The intellectual property of the documents can be well protected.
option_b: The lawyers can easily make copies of the documents.
option_c: The lawyers can save time typing documents.
option_d: The lawyers can easily retrieve and read a document.

question: In a law firm, the lawyers need to read many archive documents every day. The firm plans to scan and store its archive documents as digital images so that the lawyers can use computers to search and view the documents. The law firm uses optical character recognition (OCR) technology to convert digital images into document files. Which of the following attributes can highly affect the accuracy of the conversion during the scanning process?
What is the order of sizes of the three character sets, ASCII, Big-5 code and Unicode?
When inserting a hyperlink in a slide in a presentation file, which of the following can be linked? (1) A video file (2) A web site (3) A spreadsheet file
During data input, which of the following can minimise input errors? (1) Two's complement (2) Double entry (3) Type check
Which of the following components in a Central Processing Unit (CPU) fetches an instruction from the main memory?

A university assigns a student number, YYYYNNNG, to every new student where YYYY is the year of enrollment (e.g. 2015), NNN is a 3-digit number ranging from 000 to 999, and G is the area of study (1 stands for science and 2 stands for non-science). According to this scheme, how many student numbers the university can assign in the year of 2015?
Which of the following functions does an operating system usually have? (1) Provision of a user interface (2) Analysis of "What-if" scenarios (3) Allocation of memory (4) Construction of web pages

Which of the following statements about cache memory in CPU are correct? (1) It is better than main memory in terms of access speed. (2) It stores frequently-used data and recently-used data. (3) It is non-volatile.
Mary creates a file in HTML format instead of text format. Why? (1) Text format is not cross-platform. (2) The file can store hyperlinks. (3) Videos can be displayed when opening the file.

A company invents a smart thermostat to control the temperature of a house through the Internet. Customers can install the smart thermostat in their house and adjust the heating/cooling functions of the air conditioner from a smart phone. Which of the following best describe the application of the smart thermostat? (1) multi-user system (2) batch processing system (3) distributed processing system (4) real-time system

A company invents a smart thermostat to control the temperature of a house through the Internet. Customers can install the smart thermostat in their house and adjust the heating/cooling functions of the air conditioner from a smart phone. The smart thermostat connects to the Internet through a wireless connection. What is the advantage of this?
option_a: It is convenient for installing and controlling the thermostat.
option_c: The data can be encrypted before transmission.
option_d: Customers are required to enter a password to control the smart thermostat.

question: Mary receives an anonymous email, saying that the attached file photos.exe includes some photos of Mary. She tries to execute the file but no photos are displayed. What is/are the possible reason(s)? (1) Photo editing software has not been installed in Mary's computer. (2) The file contains malicious code that harms Mary's computer. (3) The email server cannot execute the file.
A cloud computing company not only provides cloud storage but also allows customers to make their files available offline. What is the major benefit of this arrangement?
option_a: Customers can remove the files from the cloud storage easily.
option_b: Customers can increase the bandwidth of the network connection.
option_c: Customers can access the files through their smart phones.
option_d: Customers can edit the files without Internet connection.

question: David answers the following question in his school assignment: 'What is the history of the HKEAA?' He uses a search engine and finds the following paragraph: The HKEAA was established in 2077... Which of the following actions is/are appropriate? (1) Put the entire paragraph in a search engine and search for similar results. (2) Browse other web sites to validate the information. (3) Copy the paragraph to the assignment.
John edits the font colour of a web page. How many different colours can he choose?
The following pseudocode represents part of an algorithm. IF (AGE > 6) AND (AGE < 12) THEN OUTPUT AGE Which of the following sets of test data is the most approriate?
Peter changes the format of his audio files from wav to mp3. What is his main reason for doing this?
option_a: Store the mp3 files in a network-attached storage (NAS) device.
option_b: Increase the quality of the audio data.
option_c: Reduce the storage space required for the audio data.
option_d: Create MIDI files for the audio data.

question: When solving a problem in a project, Mary needs to define the scope of the problem precisely. What is/are the major reason(s) for doing this? (1) She can break down the problem into sub-problems effectively. (2) She can use a truth table to illustrate the solution. (3) She can ignore the boundary cases when testing the algorithm.

Cindy meets her friends and shares her photos. She does not upload the photos to her social networking account. Why not? (1) Cindy wants to own the copyright of the photos. (2) Cindy wants to protect her personal privacy. (3) Cindy wants to prevent her account from being hacked.

Mr Chan wants to buy a tablet computer for his 8-year-old daughter, Susan. Which of the following actions is/are appropriate? (1) Mr Chan should buy a tablet computer with a longer battery life. (2) Susan should use the tablet computer with a mouse. (3) Susan should take a 5-minute break after using the tablet computer for 30 minutes.

Which of the following is/are ergonomic design(s)? (1) A password can be set on a wireless router to prevent access by unauthorised users. (2) The angle of the elevation/depression of a monitor display is adjustable. (3) The text shown in word processing software can be enlarged.

Which of the following statements about phishing email is/are correct? (1) Phishing email is a type of advertisement that a company sends out to target recipients. (2) Phishing email is typically carried out by sending target recipients an email with a fake web site to acquire their personal information. (3) Target recipients will not be able to use their computers for a few days after a phishing attack.
Recently some countries have attracted more females to study ICT courses and to work in the ICT industry. What is the benefit of this policy?
Which of the following functions is provided by a typical Internet browser?
option_a: Block unauthorised access to the computer.
option_d: Support the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) in online transactions.

question: In a spreadsheet, 5-digit membership numbers for a sports club, 00001, 00002, …, 99999, are entered in some cells. Which of the following cell formats should be used?
In a device, 8 bits and 16 bits are used to store a character and an integer respectively. How many bytes are required to store the string 'HKDSE5'?

Study the following three SQL commands. SELECT * FROM MEMBER; SELECT * FROM MEMBER WHERE age <= 40; SELECT * FROM MEMBER WHERE age >= 20; The results of the three SQL commands are the same. Which of the following is/are the possible cause(s)? (1) MEMBER is empty. (2) The values of the field age in MEMBER range from 20 to 40 inclusive. (3) age is the only field in MEMBER.

Mary produces daily sales reports for a supermarket on a word processor, using the data and charts stored in several spreadsheet files. The data and charts are updated frequently. Which of the following is most helpful to her?

A code consists of 6 digits where the digit on the far right is a check digit. The check digit method used for the code is that the sum of all 6 digits is divisible by 10. Which of the following codes is valid?

Mary creates a compressed file containing image files stored in several folders. She uploads the compressed file to the Internet for sharing with her friends. What are the benefits of using a compressed file? (1) The folder structure can be maintained. (2) Mary's friends can preview the images before downloading the compressed file. (3) The compressed file can be protected by password.
Consider the following values, P, Q and R. P = 10001000 (base 2)� Q = 10001000 (base 10)� R = 10001000 (base 16)� Which of the following is correct?
1111 1111 is an 8-bit number using two's complement representation. What is its decimal value?

Which of the following are characteristics of the Information Age? (1) Information is widely distributed via the Internet. (2) Information can be quickly accessed by the public. (3) All company information on the Internet is correct.
When editing numerical data in a spreadsheet, which of the following statements is correct?
option_a: Only relevant numerical data will be updated automatically.
option_b: Only relevant charts with the numerical data will be updated automatically.
option_c: Only relevant data in a single worksheet will be updated automatically.
option_d: Relevant data in multiple worksheets will be updated automatically.

question: Which of the following items can be included in a portable document format (PDF) file? (1) Hyperlinks (2) Photos (3) Formatted text

Mary uses presentation software to create a self-running slide show with verbal commentary. She uploads the slide show to her web site so that the public can view it. Which of the following must Mary do when creating the slide show?
option_a: Set the timing of each slide.
option_c: Create animation effects in the slides.
option_d: Insert background music in the slides.

question: Mary uses presentation software to create a self-running slide show with verbal commentary. She uploads the slide show to her web site so that the public can view it. When Mary chooses the file format for the slide show, which of the following is important?
Which of the following is/are the advantage(s) of using Unicode over Big-5 code? (1) Unicode is cross-platform. (2) Unicode has a bigger character set. (3) New characters can be defined in Unicode.

A booking system consists of several booking counters in different locations in a city. Customers can buy tickets for theatres through one of the booking counters. Which of the following best describes the booking system?

Peter finds that when editing video files, the performance of his home computer is better than that of his office computer. Which of the following is/are the possible cause(s) for this? (1) The read/write access speed of a hard disk (2) The storage size of ROM (3) CPU's clock rate
Which of the following functions will an operating system usually provide? (1) Control of processes (2) Allocation of memory (3) Record of network traffic
The clock rate of a CPU is 2 GHz. Which of the following statements is correct?
option_a: The CPU executes 2 × 10⁹ instructions in a second.
option_b: The CPU performs 2 × 10⁹ clock cycles in a second.
option_c: The cache memory of the CPU transfers 2 × 10⁹ instructions in a second.
option_d: The ALU of the CPU takes 2 × 10⁹ clock cycles for an instruction.

question: Peter upgrades a server by replacing the hard disk with a solid-state disk (SSD). Which of the following properties of SSD benefit(s) the upgrade? (1) Higher data transfer rate (2) Lower power consumption (3) Smaller storage capacity
When a personal computer is turned on, it loads data from the ROM and checks that all major components are functioning properly. ROM cannot be replaced by RAM in this process because
option_a: the storage size of RAM is smaller.
option_c: the data transfer rate of RAM is lower.

question: The Internet of Things (IoT) refers to the networks formed by devices which can collect and exchange data. The networks are usually connected to the Internet. Which of the following items should the devices usually have?
option_b: a CPU with a high processing power

question: Peter watches a webcasting video at home using streaming technology and finds that the video does not play smoothly. Which of the following are the possible causes? (1) Duration of the video (2) Method of Internet access (3) Bandwidth of the Internet connection

The Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government has set up GovWiFi to provide free wireless Internet access and citizens can opt to use the unencrypted connection or the encrypted connection. Which of the following statements is correct?
option_a: Citizens can only enjoy Internet access at designated spots.
option_b: Citizens cannot access online banking web sites through the unencrypted connection.
option_c: Citizens' devices can be protected from computer viruses through the encrypted connection.
option_d: Citizens will have priority to book the Government leisure facilities through GovWiFi.

question: Mr Li considers some communication links for building a network in a company and compares their effective data transfer rates. Which of the following comparisons is correct?
Peter plans to upload the background music of his school web site but the web site has limited storage space. Which of the following file formats is appropriate?
When placing a table in a web page, which of the following is not a table setting?
A bank has a secure room which only a few staff members can enter. Which of the following security measures is the most secure one for controlling access?

Cathy receives an anonymous email about changing the password of her online banking account. She clicks the hyperlink in the email and a malicious web site is displayed. Which of the following actions can help Cathy ensure that she is browsing a trusted web site?
option_a: Ensure that the domain name does not contain '.ru'.
option_b: Verify the digital certificates of the web site.
option_c: Follow hyperlinks in emails sent by friends instead of anonymously.
option_d: Enable a firewall before browsing the Internet.

question: What is the aim of the following policy? "The Government helps families in need acquire computers and Internet access, and delivers personal support and training to them so children and parents can tap the online world's potential."
option_a: Promoting the freedom of information on the Internet
option_c: Promoting the change in the nature of work

question: Peter is a student and does the following actions. Which of them are illegal? (1) Uses a BT program to share his homework. (2) Uses a BT program to download copyrighted songs for his own use. (3) Buys copyrighted software and makes copies for his best friends only.

Mary downloads three types of programs, P, Q and R from the Internet. She can use P for a trial period, changes the source code of Q and only uses some functions in R. Which type(s) of program is/are shareware?

(2) Data from different applications can remain synchronised. (3) Data from different applications can be stored in the same folder.
Amy plans to upload her photos to cloud storage. What is the benefit of using JPG format instead of BMP format in this case?
option_a: Decreases the width and length of the photos.
option_b: Decreases the file size of the photos.
option_c: Increases the number of pixels in the photos.
option_d: Increases the number of colours in the photos.

question: When a digital photo is printed on photo paper, the top and bottom parts of the photo paper are unused. What is/are the possible reason(s) for this? (1) The aspect ratios of the digital photo and the photo paper are not the same. (2) The file size of the digital photo is too large. (3) The colour depth of the digital photo is too low.

What is the major benefit of using a form in a database management system?
option_d: Filters data in a single database table.

question: For a chain convenience store, in which of the following examples should 'what-if' scenarios in spreadsheets be used? (1) Estimates monthly expenses by changing different parameters. (2) Produces monthly sales analysis. (3) Compares sales data from different branches.

A computer is used to edit videos. Which of the following specifications have a significant impact on the performance of the computer? (1) Size of RAM (2) Number of USB ports (3) CPU clock rate

option_c: They are used as secondary storage.

question: What information is usually provided by the system monitoring software in an operating system? (1) Current processes (2) Memory usage (3) Network traffic

Which of the following is/are the advantage(s) of setting up a wireless network to replace a wired network? (1) Increased network speed. (2) Enhanced network security. (3) Increased mobility of computers.
Amy wants to buy a colour laser printer for use at home. What specifications should she consider? (1) Brightness (lm) (2) Printing speed (ppm) (3) Resolution (dpi)

The problem-solving procedures for developing a computer system are listed below. What is the correct order of the procedures? (1) Tests the system. (2) Defines the problem. (3) Designs the algorithm. (4) Writes the program codes.
Which of the following is/are security measure(s) an online bank can use to authenticate customers' identities? (1) Antivirus software (2) Security token (3) Digital watermark

Which of the following behaviours may infringe intellectual property rights? (1) Sending an email with a virus to a friend (2) Hacking into an online bank account (3) Posting a scanned newspaper on a personal web site (4) Uploading a video of a TV programme to the Internet

What changes have been brought about by the emergence of the Information Age? (1) More office space is needed. (2) New ICT-related jobs appear and change the job market. (3) There are more opportunities to acquire information and to learn new things.

Ransomware is malware that encrypts victims' computer files and demands a ransom payment to restore them. How can we minimise the impact of ransomware? (1) Creates backups of computer files regularly. (2) Do not open anonymous or phishing email. (3) Do not download pirated copies of computer software through p2p software.

The World Health Organization (WHO) states that 15% of the world's population have disabilities. What can we do for these people to improve the access to ICT significantly?

option_b: Sets up free computer centres for persons with disabilities to access the Internet.
option_c: Develops appropriate tools for persons with disabilities to access ICT.
option_d: Provides free ICT training for persons with disabilities.

question: When changing the password of a school Intranet account, which of the following is an example of data verification?

option_c: Input a new password that consists of at least one special character.

question: Free online encyclopedias such as Wikipedia contain a huge number of articles. Which of the following statements about the online encyclopedias are correct? question: Which of the following are the basic functions of an operating system? (1) Email management (2) Memory management (3) Input/output management

option_c: The data access rate of a SSD is lower.

question: Which of the following can help reduce the time needed to access files in a hard disk drive?

(1) The viewable size of the display unit (2) The maximum data transfer rate of a wireless network (3) The time to start up a computer

question: In a Point-Of-Sale system in a restaurant, which of the following is/are the reason(s) for using thermal printers to print receipts? (1) The receipt printout can be kept longer. (2) It is quiet during printing. (3) The printing time is short.

option_b: Both computers should have the same firewall.

question: Which of the following is not an email protocol?

option_b: It is used by the Control Unit (CU) to store a memory address temporarily.
option_c: It stores the memory address of the next instruction to be executed.
option_d: It controls the flow of data in a bus.

question: What is the possible outcome of lowering the clock rate of a CPU in a desktop computer?

(1) Allowing communication between computers (2) Controlling the network bandwidth of a connection between two computers (3) Providing some measure of network security to protect the computers from unauthorised access

question: Which of the following statements about streaming technology is/are correct? (1) A music performance can be viewed live. (2) HTTP cannot be used. (3) Illegal distribution of movies can be controlled.

question: A photographer posts his photos to a social media web site for the public to look at. Which of the following can be applied to the photo to protect his intellectual property?

question: When Eva logs on to a web site, she will receive an SMS message on her phone with a password. What is the SMS message about?

An online shop collects its members' personal information. Which of the following actions is/are not appropriate without members' consent? (1) The shop encrypts and uploads all personal information to cloud storage. (2) The shop sends all personal information to other online shops which provide other services to members. (3) When a member unregisters his/her membership, the shop keeps the personal information permanently to help with his/her re-registration in the future.
